update.description:
This is mostly changing `GAZEBO_VISIBLE` to `GZ_COMMON_VISIBLE`, needed for windows.

[Jenkins clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/104/)

update.title: Windows common upgrade, part1

content.raw: Got it! With some help from [Stack Overflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/57999/what-is-the-difference-between-dllexport-and-dllimport) to clarify dllexport vs dllimport.
content.html: Got it! With some help from Stack Overflow to clarify dllexport vs dllimport.

content.raw: I have 4 more pull requests to `gazebo_common` either in the queue or blocked on this pull request.
content.html: I have 4 more pull requests to gazebo_common either in the queue or blocked on this pull request.

content.raw: I won't expect the build to be able to compile the whole gazebo but should `make gazebo_common` work?
content.html: I won't expect the build to be able to compile the whole gazebo but should make gazebo_common work?

content.raw: I don't expect the windows build to succeed. I've broken win_nate2 into many small parts, all of which will compile on mac and linux but none (or mostly none) of which will compile on Windows.
content.html: I don't expect the windows build to succeed. I've broken win_nate2 into many small parts, all of which will compile on mac and linux but none (or mostly none) of which will compile on Windows.

content.raw: I've modified the jenkins script to compile gazebo_common. [Testing run ongoing](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-windows7-amd64/9/console)
content.html: I've modified the jenkins script to compile gazebo_common. Testing run ongoing

@gerkey and I found that the problem was that VISIBLE keyword need to act differently when you are compiling the own library (let's say gazebo_common) and when you are compiling all the rest of the other gazebo libraries that use the previous library (let's say gazebo_physics using gazebo_common), since the VISIBLE keyword is in the headers, which are used when compiling other libraries.

Following the example, when you are compiling gazebo_common, you want the GZ_COMMON_VISIBLE set to dllexport, but when you are compiling gazebo_physics, you want GZ_COMMON_VISIBLE set to dllimport while you need a different one GZ_PHYSICS_VISIBLE set to dllexport.

More or less clear?

Actually, on second thought, if it's for Windows I probably don't want to know.
